body.p: Marinus Schraal, one of our GNOME developers writes: "Just five months after the 2.0 release the GNOME team brings you GNOME 2.2. Besides overall stability and speed improvements, it also includes a lot of new features such as recent files functionality, startup notification, a notification area applet and much more. For a comprehensive list, see the release notes
Currently it is marked stable for x86, other arches will follow soon. Based on the information in this bug, we recommend not building GNOME 2.2 with a locale set of *UTF-8 locale set."
